title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 8 ยง 587.2 - Definitions
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 8 ยง 587.2 - Definitions

State Regulations
(0)

Unless
otherwise expressly stated, whenever used in these regulations, the following
terms shall respectively be deemed to mean and include each of the meanings
and/or the meanings as set forth in the New York State Vehicle and Traffic

Law. (a) State University

Plaza personnel. All persons employed at State University Plaza or

University properties by the State University of New York, the State University

Construction Fund, the Research Foundation of the State University of New York, or other persons who may be deemed State University Plaza personnel for the
purposes of this Part, where such persons continuously and regularly conduct
business or have dealing with the State University. (b) University police officer. Any person employed or designated by the State University
of New York as a police officer and a member of the University Police

Department, for the purpose of enforcing law, order and observance of the rules
and regulations enacted by the State University Board of Trustees, pursuant to
section
355
(2)(l)
of the Education Law of the State of

New York, as amended. (c) Parking place. Any part or area on any university property, duly
designated as a place for the parking of vehicles. (d) Pedestrian right-of-way. Any road, sidewalk or other place in any university
property, the use of which is restricted or limited to persons on
foot. (e) Service
roadway. Any road in any university property, the use of which is
restricted or limited. (f) University property. All property and facilities owned and operated by SUNY
System. Administration. Such property and facilities shall include, but not be
limited to, System University Plaza, located at 353 Broadway, Albany, NY, 12246
and its adjoining parking structure. (g) Parking ticket. Written documentation providing a person alleged to have
violated a provision of the New York State Vehicle and Traffic Law with notice
of such violation. Parking tickets shall be returnable in the local court with
jurisdiction over such violation. (h) Parking citation. Written documentation providing a person alleged to have
violated a provision of this Part with notice of such parking or traffic
violation. Parking citations shall be answerable at System Administration and
shall be adjudicated pursuant to the administrative procedure described in
section
587.5
of this

Part. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 8
ยง
587.2

Adopted

New

York State Register July 15, 2020/Volume XLII, Issue 28, eff. 7/15/2020

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
